summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Lieutenant's Log for the morning watch shift on August 10, 2019. It records the routine operations and counts, culminating in a medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a hospital while CPR was in progress.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054, found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in Unit 9 South, prompting a medical emergency. CPR was performed and he was transported to a local hospital.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate #86824-054, noted as being in a Dry Cell under Restrictive-A status in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein in cell Z06-220 of Unit 9 South. He was found unresponsive. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and he was transported by ambulance to a local hospital with CPR continuing.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at the MCC New York at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein by correctional staff and continued by EMTs after an ambulance arrived. He was transported to a local hospital with CPR still in progress.
The log indicates Epstein was housed in Unit 9 South, not in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) or on psychological observation at the time of the incident.
The document is an official prison operations log, recording routine counts, equipment checks, and the specific timeline of the emergency response to Epstein's condition.
